Section Name: Name and territory of the Union
Description: Declares India as a "Union of States." States do not have the right to secede. The territory of India includes states

Section Name: Admission or establishment of new States
Description: Empowers Parliament to admit or establish new states by law. This allows for territorial reorganization and the inclusion of new regions.

Section Name: Formation of new States and alteration of areas
Description: boundaries or names of existing States
column8: or names of existing states. The consent of the state is sought but not required.

Section Name: Laws made under articles 2 and 3 to provide for the amendment of the First and the Fourth Schedules and supplemental
Description: incidental and consequential matters
column5: Enables laws altering states to modify Schedules of the Constitution and address supplementary or consequential matters.

Section Name: Citizenship at the commencement of the Constitution
Description: Defines who was considered a citizen of India at the commencement of the Constitution based on birth

Section Name: Rights of citizenship of certain persons who have migrated to India from Pakistan
Description: Grants citizenship to people migrating from Pakistan before a certain date
column5: subject to residence or registration requirements.

Section Name: Rights of citizenship of certain migrants to Pakistan
Description: Specifies that persons who migrated to Pakistan after 1947 will not be Indian citizens unless they returned under resettlement schemes.

Section Name: Rights of citizenship of certain persons of Indian origin residing outside India
Description: Grants citizenship to people of Indian origin residing outside India
column5: provided they have registered as citizens.

Section Name: Persons voluntarily acquiring citizenship of a foreign State not to be citizens
Description: States that Indian citizenship is automatically terminated for any individual who voluntarily acquires the citizenship of another country.

Section Name: Continuance of the rights of citizenship
Description: Ensures that the rights of citizenship shall continue for all Indian citizens unless otherwise stated by law.

Section Name: Parliament to regulate the right of citizenship by law
Description: Empowers Parliament to make laws governing the acquisition and termination of Indian citizenship.

Section Name: Definition of State
Description: Defines the term "State" for the purpose of Part III (Fundamental Rights) to include the government

Section Name: Laws inconsistent with or in derogation of the fundamental rights
Description: Declares any law inconsistent with the Fundamental Rights as void and protects Fundamental Rights from being violated by state action.

Section Name: Equality before law
Description: Guarantees equality before the law and equal protection of the laws to all persons within the territory of India.

Section Name: Prohibition of discrimination on grounds of religion
Description: race
column7: Prohibits discrimination by the state against any citizen on the grounds of religion

Section Name: Equality of opportunity in matters of public employment
Description: Guarantees equal opportunity for all citizens in matters related to public employment
column5: with provisions for the reservation of backward classes.

Section Name: Abolition of Untouchability
Description: Abolishes untouchability and forbids its practice in any form. It provides for punishment for those engaging in untouchability.

Section Name: Abolition of titles
Description: Prohibits the state from conferring any titles except for military and academic distinctions. Citizens of India cannot accept titles from foreign states.

Section Name: Protection of certain rights regarding freedom of speech
Description: etc.
column5: Guarantees freedom of speech and expression

Section Name: Protection in respect of conviction for offences
Description: Provides protection against retrospective criminal laws

Section Name: Protection of life and personal liberty
Description: Guarantees the right to life and personal liberty except according to the procedure established by law.

Section Name: Right to education
Description: Makes the provision for free and compulsory education to all children between the ages of six to fourteen as a Fundamental Right.

Section Name: Protection against arrest and detention in certain cases
Description: Provides safeguards against arbitrary arrest and detention by laying down the rights of the detained individuals.

Section Name: Prohibition of traffic in human beings and forced labour
Description: Prohibits human trafficking
column7: with exceptions for compulsory services for public purposes.

Section Name: Prohibition of employment of children in factories
Description: etc.
column5: Bans the employment of children under the age of 14 in factories

Section Name: Freedom of conscience and free profession
Description: practice and propagation of religion
column5: Guarantees all persons the freedom of conscience and the right to freely profess

Section Name: Freedom to manage religious affairs
Description: Grants religious denominations the right to establish and maintain institutions

Section Name: Freedom as to payment of taxes for promotion of any particular religion
Description: Prohibits the state from compelling any individual to pay taxes for the promotion or maintenance of any particular religion.

Section Name: Freedom as to attendance at religious instruction or religious worship in certain educational institutions
Description: Prohibits religious instruction in state-funded educational institutions while allowing religious instruction in institutions established by religious groups.

Section Name: Protection of interests of minorities
Description: Protects the rights of minorities to conserve their language

Section Name: Right of minorities to establish and administer educational institutions
Description: Grants minorities the right to establish and administer educational institutions of their choice and ensures state aid is not denied on the grounds of religion or language.

Section Name: (Repealed) Compulsory acquisition of property
Description: This article dealt with the state's authority to acquire private property for public purposes and has been repealed.

Section Name: Saving of Laws providing for acquisition of estates
Description: etc.
column5: Protects laws relating to the acquisition of estates
column7: and abolition of the zamindari system from being challenged under the Fundamental Rights.

Section Name: Validation of certain Acts and Regulations
Description: Validates laws placed in the Ninth Schedule
column5: preventing them from being challenged in courts for violating Fundamental Rights.

Section Name: Saving of laws giving effect to certain directive principles
Description: Protects laws enacted to implement certain Directive Principles of State Policy
column5: ensuring that such laws cannot be challenged under Fundamental Rights.

Section Name: Remedies for enforcement of rights conferred by this Part
Description: Grants the right to individuals to move the Supreme Court directly for the enforcement of their Fundamental Rights.

Section Name: Power of Parliament to modify the rights conferred by this Part in their application to Forces
Description: etc.
column5: Allows Parliament to restrict or modify the application of Fundamental Rights for members of the armed forces

Section Name: Restriction on rights conferred by this Part while martial law is in force in any area
Description: Permits the restriction of Fundamental Rights when martial law is in force in a particular area.

Section Name: Legislation to give effect to the provisions of this Part
Description: Empowers Parliament to make laws to enforce provisions related to Fundamental Rights.

Section Name: Definition
Description: Defines the term "State" for the purpose of the Directive Principles as the government and Parliament

Section Name: Application of the principles contained in this Part
Description: States that the Directive Principles are fundamental in the governance of the country and it is the duty of the state to apply these principles in making laws.

Section Name: State to secure a social order for the promotion of welfare of the people
Description: Directs the state to secure and promote the welfare of the people by creating a social
column6: and political order based on justice.

Section Name: Certain principles of policy to be followed by the State
Description: Provides for securing adequate means of livelihood

Section Name: Equal justice and free legal aid
Description: Directs the state to promote equal justice and ensure that legal aid is provided to the poor and disadvantaged.

Section Name: Organisation of village panchayats
Description: Directs the state to organize village panchayats and grant them powers necessary for local governance.

Section Name: Right to work
Description: to education and to public assistance in certain cases
column5: Directs the state to ensure the right to work
column7: and public assistance in cases of unemployment
column10: and other conditions of undeserved want.

Section Name: Provision for just and humane conditions of work and maternity relief
Description: Ensures just and humane conditions of work and maternity relief for women.

Section Name: Living wage
Description: etc.
column6: Directs the state to secure a living wage

Section Name: Participation of workers in management of industries
Description: Promotes the participation of workers in the management of industries to ensure their welfare.

Section Name: Uniform civil code for the citizens
Description: Directs the state to secure a uniform civil code for all citizens across India.

Section Name: Provision for early childhood care and education to children below the age of six years
Description: Directs the state to provide free early childhood care and education for children under six years of age.

Section Name: Promotion of educational and economic interests of Scheduled Castes
Description: Scheduled Tribes and other weaker sections
column5: Directs the state to promote and protect the educational and economic interests of Scheduled Castes
column7: and other weaker sections of society.

Section Name: Duty of the State to raise the level of nutrition and the standard of living and to improve public health
Description: Directs the state to improve nutrition

Section Name: Organisation of agriculture and animal husbandry
Description: Directs the state to promote modern agricultural practices and improve animal husbandry.

Section Name: Protection and improvement of environment and safeguarding of forests and wildlife
Description: Directs the state to protect and improve the environment

Section Name: Protection of monuments and places and objects of national importance
Description: Directs the state to protect monuments
column6: and objects of historical or artistic importance.

Section Name: Separation of judiciary from executive
Description: Directs the state to ensure the separation of the judiciary from the executive in public services.

Section Name: Promotion of international peace and security
Description: Directs the state to promote international peace
column6: and foster friendly relations among nations.

Section Name: Fundamental duties
Description: Lists fundamental duties of citizens

Section Name: The President of India
Description: Establishes the office of the President of India

Section Name: Executive power of the Union
Description: Vests executive power of the Union in the President

Section Name: Election of President
Description: Describes the process of electing the President

Section Name: Manner of election of President
Description: Details the manner of Presidential election

Section Name: Term of office of President
Description: Specifies the term of office for the President

Section Name: Eligibility for re-election
Description: Allows for re-election of the President

Section Name: Qualifications for election as President
Description: Lists qualifications for Presidential candidates

Section Name: Conditions of President's office
Description: Outlines conditions of the President's office

Section Name: Oath or affirmation by the President
Description: Prescribes the oath to be taken by the President

Section Name: Procedure for impeachment of the President
Description: Details the procedure for impeaching the President

Section Name: Time of holding election to fill vacancy in the office of President and the term of office of person elected to fill casual vacancy
Description: Regulates elections to fill Presidential vacancies

Section Name: The Vice-President of India
Description: Establishes the office of the Vice-President

Section Name: The Vice-President to be ex officio Chairman of the Council of States
Description: Makes Vice-President the ex-officio Chairman of Rajya Sabha

Section Name: The Vice-President to act as President or to discharge his functions during casual vacancies in the office
Description: or during the absence
column6: Outlines Vice-President's role in President's absence

Section Name: Election of Vice-President
Description: Describes the process of electing the Vice-President

Section Name: Term of office of Vice-President
Description: Specifies the term of office for the Vice-President

Section Name: Time of holding election to fill vacancy in the office of Vice-President and the term of office of person elected to fill casual vacancy
Description: Regulates elections to fill Vice-Presidential vacancies

Section Name: Oath or affirmation by the Vice-President
Description: Prescribes the oath to be taken by the Vice-President

Section Name: Discharge of President's functions in other contingencies
Description: Provides for discharge of President's functions in certain contingencies

Section Name: Matters relating to
Description: or connected with
column5: the election of a President or Vice-President
column6: Regulates matters related to Presidential and Vice-Presidential elections

Section Name: Power of President to grant pardons
Description: etc.
column6: remit or commute sentences in certain cases
column7: Defines President's power to grant pardons

Section Name: Extent of executive power of the Union
Description: Defines the extent of Union's executive power

Section Name: Council of Ministers to aid and advise President
Description: Establishes the Council of Ministers

Section Name: Other provisions as to Ministers
Description: Regulates appointment and tenure of Ministers

Section Name: Attorney-General for India
Description: Establishes the office of Attorney-General for India

Section Name: Conduct of business of the Government of India
Description: Regulates conduct of government business

Section Name: Duties of Prime Minister as respects the furnishing of information to the President
Description: etc.
column5: Outlines Prime Minister's duties to inform the President

Section Name: Constitution of Parliament
Description: Defines the composition of Parliament

Section Name: Composition of the Council of States
Description: Describes the composition of Rajya Sabha

Section Name: Composition of the House of the People
Description: Describes the composition of Lok Sabha

Section Name: Readjustment after each census
Description: Provides for readjustment of constituencies after each census

Section Name: Duration of Houses of Parliament
Description: Specifies the duration of Parliament

Section Name: Qualification for membership of Parliament
Description: Lists qualifications for Members of Parliament

Section Name: Sessions of Parliament
Description: prorogation and dissolution

Section Name: Right of President to address and send messages to Houses
Description: Allows President to address and send messages to Houses

Section Name: Special address by the President
Description: Provides for special address by the President

Section Name: Rights of Ministers and Attorney-General as respects Houses
Description: Outlines rights of Ministers and Attorney-General in Parliament

Section Name: The Chairman and Deputy Chairman of the Council of States
Description: Establishes offices of Chairman and Deputy Chairman of Rajya Sabha

Section Name: Vacation and resignation of
Description: and removal from

Section Name: Power of the Deputy Chairman or other person to perform the duties of the office of
Description: or to act as
column6: Allows Deputy Chairman to act as Chairman

Section Name: The Chairman or the Deputy Chairman not to preside while a resolution for his removal from office is under consideration
Description: Prohibits Chairman/Deputy from presiding during removal proceedings

Section Name: The Speaker and Deputy Speaker of the House of the People
Description: Establishes offices of Speaker and Deputy Speaker of Lok Sabha

Section Name: Vacation and resignation of
Description: and removal from
column5: the offices of Speaker and Deputy Speaker
column8: and removal of Speaker and Deputy Speaker

Section Name: Power of the Deputy Speaker or other person to perform the duties of the office of
Description: or to act as
column6: Allows Deputy Speaker to act as Speaker

Section Name: The Speaker or the Deputy Speaker not to preside while a resolution for his removal from office is under consideration
Description: Prohibits Speaker/Deputy from presiding during removal proceedings

Section Name: Salaries and allowances of the Chairman and Deputy Chairman and the Speaker and Deputy Speaker
Description: Provides for salaries of Parliamentary officers

Section Name: Secretariat of Parliament
Description: Establishes separate secretariats for each House of Parliament

Section Name: Oath or affirmation by members
Description: Prescribes oath for Members of Parliament

Section Name: Voting in Houses
Description: power of Houses to act notwithstanding vacancies and quorum
column5: Regulates voting and quorum in Parliament
